async_info.video_title: UK election: Prime Minister rejects Farage Brexit pact - BBC News
async_info.video_description:
Boris Johnson has rejected the suggestion from Nigel Farage and Donald Trump that he should work with the Brexit Party during the UK election. It comes as the Brexit Party launched their campaign, with their leader calling on the Prime Minister to ditch his deal with the European Union.
Deputy Political Editor John Pienaar reports on the Brexit Party campaign launch, and Political Editor Laura Kuenssberg interviews Boris Johnson.
Part of coverage for the BBC News at Ten.
Please subscribe HERE http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

comment_content.original_script: BoJo just lied in this interview completely.... His Deal does not make us Free, he is ticking a milestone date called "leave the EU" but all the deal problems have been kicked down the road for another 3 years and during that time any EU deal is adjudicated by the ECJ, how can that end up being a good deal for the UK. There a number of other EU hooks in the deal as well.. Just read people....

There a number of other EU hooks in the deal as well.. Just read people....

comment_content.original_script: England, UK how is it that AFTER years & years of trying to free yourself you can't? Choose Farage to lead you to freedom from the EU so you can once AGAIN, be truly a Sovereign independent nation with the ability to trade with nations that will NOT exploit and oppress you as the EU has been doing to you. Get truly free from the EU like you were before the EU tricked you into bed with them. Like May, Johnson is NOT working in the best interest of the people of England and UK. Dump him.

comment_content.original_script:
It's just the UK, not "England and UK". England is one of the four countries which makes up our nation.

Moreover, Farage has stood for election a ridiculous number of times, and never gotten anywhere near victory. I know his supporters make a lot of noise, but the majority of this country has no appetite to back someone like him.
